revised_title: Asymptotic Analysis of Large-Amplitude Gortler Vortices in Growing Boundary Layers
tldr: The authors investigate the fully nonlinear development of Gortler vortices in growing boundary layers using a combination of asymptotic and numerical methods. They find that large-amplitude vortices can drive the boundary layer and adjust the mean flow to make them locally neutral. The mean flow in the region of vortex activity has a'square-root' profile, and the vortex velocity field can be written down in closed form. The upper and lower boundaries of the region of vortex activity are determined by a free-boundary problem involving the boundary-layer equations.
